australia.name: Australia
australia.description: Home of the Great Barrier Reef, world-class temperate and tropical diving.

great-barrier-reef.name: Great Barrier Reef
great-barrier-reef.description: The world's largest coral reef system, famous for vibrant marine life and coral gardens.

ningaloo-reef.name: Ningaloo Reef
ningaloo-reef.description: Swim with whale sharks, manta rays, and pristine fringing reefs in Western Australia.

coral-sea.name: Coral Sea
coral-sea.description: Remote reefs, big pelagics, and dramatic drop-offs east of the Great Barrier Reef.

lord-howe-island.name: Lord Howe Island
lord-howe-island.description: UNESCO World Heritage island with unique species and clear waters.

tasmania.name: Tasmania
tasmania.description: Kelp forests, weedy sea dragons, and temperate diving at the edge of the Southern Ocean.

sydney.name: Sydney
sydney.description: City diving with weedy sea dragons, sharks, and shipwrecks.

melbourne.name: Melbourne
melbourne.description: Wrecks, piers, and unique temperate marine life in Port Phillip Bay.

south-australia.name: South Australia
south-australia.description: Cage diving with great white sharks and leafy sea dragons in temperate waters.

rowley-shoals.name: Rowley Shoals
rowley-shoals.description: Remote atolls off Western Australia, famous for clear water and pristine reefs.
